content.text: A boat crosses a river. The boat points at right angles to the river bank and it travels at a speed of \(3.5 \text{m / s}\) relative to the water
A river current acts at right angles to the direction the boat points. The river current has a speed of \(2.5 \text{m / s}\)
By drawing a scale diagram or by calculation, determine the speed and direction of the boat relative to the river bank
speed =
direction relative to the river bank =
Speed is a scalar quantity and velocity is a vector quantity
State the names of one other scalar quantity and one other vector quantity
scalar quantity
vector quantity
The ship is made of steel
The density of steel is \(7800 \text{kg} / \text{m}^3\) and the density of water is \(1000 \text{kg} / \text{m}^3\)
Explain why the ship floats in the water
The containers with the greatest mass are loaded near the bottom of the ship
State and explain the effect on the stability of the ship of loading the containers in this way
A crane lifts a container \(48 \text{m}\) vertically upwards. The mass of the container is \(30 000 \text{kg}\)
Calculate the energy transferred to the gravitational potential energy stored in the container
Fig. 2.1 shows a ship loaded with containers
State the principle of conservation of energy
Define the unit kWh
Calculate the energy produced by the wind turbine operating at maximum power for 4.0 h. Give your answer in kWh
A wind turbine has a maximum output power of 1.8MW. The turbine operates at maximum power for 4.0 h
Radiation from the Sun is the main source of energy for most of our energy resources
State two energy resources that are **not** due to radiation from the Sun
Thermal energy is transferred through the metal pan by conduction
State and explain the two ways that thermal energy is conducted in a metal
The water boils and leaves the liquid as a gas
Explain, in terms of forces and distances between particles, why the gas occupies a much greater volume than it does as a liquid
State two ways in which boiling differs from evaporation
The water is replaced with \(200 \text{cm}^3\) of milk
The initial temperature of the milk is \(20.0^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\). The boiling point of milk is \(95.0^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
The milk starts to boil when \(60 700 \text{J}\) of thermal energy has been transferred to it. The density of milk is \(1.03 \text{g} /\text{cm}^3\)
Calculate the value of the specific heat capacity of milk. Give your answer to 3 significant figures
specific heat capacity =   .........
Fig. 4.1 shows a metal pan on an electric hotplate. The pan contains \(200 \text{cm}^3\) of water
The pan is heated. The temperature of the water in the pan increases
Calculate the critical angle for the plastic
critical angle =   .........
On Fig. 5.1, draw the path of the ray in the block and after the ray emerges from the block
Fig. 5.1 shows a semicircular transparent plastic block
A ray of light is incident normally on the curved surface of the block. The refractive index of the plastic is 1.5
Determine the focal length of the lens
focal length =   .........
Fig. 5.2 is a full-scale diagram of a lens and an object O
The point marked F shows the position of a principal focus of the lens
Fig. 5.3 shows a simplified diagram of an eye with rays from a distant object and the path of the rays inside the eye of a person with short sight
On Fig. 5.4, draw an additional lens outside the eye to correct short-sightedness and show the path of the rays inside the eye
Fig. 5.4
Sound waves have compressions and rarefactions
Explain what is meant by compression and rarefaction
compression
rarefaction
We can see light from the Sun but we cannot hear any sound from it
State the reason for this
During a thunderstorm, an observer sees the lightning almost immediately but hears the sound of the thunder several seconds later. The thunder and lightning are produced at the same time
The sound of the thunder is heard 9.0s after the lightning is seen. The speed of sound in air is \(340 \text{m/s}\)
Calculate the distance from the thunderstorm to the observer
distance =   .........
In a lightning strike, there is a current of \(3.0 \times 10^{4} \text{A}\) for \(48 \text{ms}\)
Calculate the charge that flows
Define potential difference (p.d.)
State the equation which defines electromotive force (e.m.f.) \(E\)
The e.m.f. of a battery is 9.0V. The battery is in a circuit
Calculate the work done by the battery when it moves a charge of 30 C around a complete circuit
work done =
Draw a circuit diagram of these components connected in series
Explain what happens in the circuit you have drawn in (c)(i) when the temperature of the thermistor is increased
A circuit consists of a d.c. power supply, a lamp and a thermistor
Determine the direction of movement of the side AB relative to the plane of the coil
Explain how you determined the direction in (a)
State and explain what happens to the coil as it reaches the vertical position
To operate as a motor, a split-ring commutator and brushes are added to the parts shown in Fig. 8.1
Explain the effects of the split-ring commutator and the brushes on the action of the motor
Fig. 8.1 shows a horizontal, flat coil in a magnetic field
The coil is connected to a cell. The coil rotates
Explain what is meant by nuclear fission
State one advantage and one disadvantage of generating electrical power in nuclear power stations compared with electrical power generated using wind turbines
advantage
disadvantage
A nuclear power station has a reactor where controlled nuclear fission of uranium-235 takes place
Deuterium is an isotope of hydrogen (H) with 1 proton and 1 neutron. Nuclear fusion occurs when two nuclei of deuterium combine. An isotope of helium (He) and a neutron are formed
Use nuclide notation to write down the nuclide equation for this reaction
The time taken for Mars to orbit the Sun is 690 Earth days. The average orbital radius of Mars is \(2.28 \times 10^{8} \text{km}\). An Earth day is \(24 \text{h}\)
Calculate the average orbital speed of Mars in km/s
average speed =   .........
State the shape of the orbits of the planets
Explain what is meant by redshift
State the quantity that the redshift of a galaxy is used to calculate
Light from a distant galaxy is redshifted
